intro: Renealmia acreana, commonly known as the Amazonian arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features slender, grass-like stems and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense clusters. Its rhizomes are thick and starchy, making it a valuable source of edible carbohydrates. The botanical characteristics of Renealmia acreana make it well adapted to the humid, nutrient-rich environments of the Amazon basin.
